p: Injecting drug use (IDU) has been associated with increased risk of HIV, HBV, and HCV infections [ 9– 12]. The prevalence of IDU vary greatly between countries, ranging from 0·02% to 5·21% [ 9]. A few studies conducted in Africa have reported IDU to be on the rise with potential significant contribution to the occurrence and spread of blood-borne infections [ 12– 14].
